intro: Cuphea mesochloa, commonly known as the silverleaf cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage and clusters of tubular, pinkish-red flowers. The plant belongs to the Lythraceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for tropical and subtropical landscapes. Cuphea mesochloa is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
